title: Excellent service above and beyond
body:
All i can say is from the moment i spoke to the receptionist on the day i was coming in - to leaving the surgery after my appointment  the service i got was spot on ! I wanted support with one of my self administering injections and due to anxiety  i was suffering  i did t feel i could do it .This was no problem - the receptionist reassured  me ( in a personal but professional manner ) that this would be fine and a nurse saw me the same day .
She was also spot on and went “above and beyond “ what she needed to do and say .
i felt listened to and put at ease throughout snd my anxiety which started my day off as a 9  ( on a scale  of 0-10) reduced to a 2/3 by the end of my appointment! i don’t know the nurses name  or the receptionist - but if you’re reading this you’ll know who you are !
Sadly whilst i think it’s ok to hive constructive criticism there are people who have left reviews which are personal and not what our  dedicated NHS staff need x

title: Elm Breast Clinic - Fantastic
body:
I had foolishly put off seeking advice for a breast concern out of fear. Following a 10 day GP referral I was seen at the Elm Breast Clinic within just 5 days at the weekend. The hospital felt very COVID safe. 
I had an initial examination by a specialist, followed by a mammogram & ultrasound & a further meeting with the specialist. At all times the breast care team put me at my ease & took time to explain what they were doing. Whilst the specialist felt everything was ok. It was necessary in my case to obtain a previous mammogram for comparison. This was from a private hospital I had used a few years ago. This had to be requested & therefore could not be obtained that day. The next working day I received a call to let me know that the mammograms compared & fortunately everything was ok. The care & service I received from the Elm Breast Clinic has been outstanding & the timescales far quicker than I could ever have expected. A credit to the NHS thank you

readBy.name: Barking, Havering and Redbridge University Hospitals NHS Trust

title: Brilliant care
body: Great service - they must be swamped at the moment but still offered brilliant care on my phone appointment. They were incredibly thorough and made sure I was happy with my care plan. I felt really reassured. I would definitely recommend this practice.

title: Kind , caring and extremely hard working
body:
From the moment I entered the hospital I knew my daughter was in safe hands 
We received undivided care  and attention which was given with the upmost respect and dignity 
I cannot falter the care that my daughter has received in any way 
Acorn ward staff really did nurse my daughter f back from being very poorly back to good health 
In which I am grateful

title: Amazing care
body: Even at this difficult time, the care I have received from community midwives, antenatal and maternity has been great. When I found out I was expecting twins I was offered extra appointments and checks. All the midwives, midwife assistants, doctors, registrars, surgeons and anesthetists I have had contact with have been helpful, kind and supportive of my choices. The care taken of myself and my daughters was extremely thorough. I was also very impressed with the support I received from all staff with breastfeeding. Everyone was knowledgeable and helpful. When we were re admitted due to one of the twins jaundice, this great care continued not only towards my Ill daughter but also my other daughter and myself. Considering the impact of covid ( restrictions an staffing shortages) I do not think I could have had a better experience. Thank you to all the staff for making me feel safe and cared for.

title: Great all round practice
body: Went above and beyond to test, diagnose and supply medicine for my child who was unwell with bladder infection. I was most pleased with the service after calling up late afternoon and not expecting them to squeeze us in so quickly. Receptionist was very friendly and helpful.

title: Teething Problems
body: They are finally getting their act together , technician is brilliant, they are more accommodating than they were, I hope this is going to continue.

title: Under funded
body: Staff do a good job even though under funded and are helpful and take pride in their work even under the difficult conditions of corona virus

title: Bad experience
body: I was referred to this place for a flue jab. The nurse serving me seems to be under stress. She asked me take my jacket and shirt off ( nowhere to place them in the room) and squeeze them in between my legs. No politeness and no courtesy. But the lady at the reception door was an angle.

title: Excellent Care and Amazing Staff
body: The treatment I received at this hospital was tremendous and I can not fault it in any way whatsoever. Thanks, Hinchingbrooke.

readBy.name: North West Anglia NHS Foundation Trust

title: So kind
body:
Thank you to every single member of staff I met on Loddon Ward. I had Covid Pneumonia and was in their excellent hands for 6 days. The care, kindness, attention and treatment was stunning and they work long hours with cheerful spirits consistently, despite some very, very difficult circumstances- which are obviously just an accepted part of their "normal, everyday life". Angels indeed and I'm well on the mend. 
Thank you from the bottom of my heart.
Gillie xxxx

title: Excellent village Surgery
body:
This surgery is exactly what is needed in a small village.
All the Team, from, Receptionists, nurses and doctors, are friendly, professional and helpful.
They all go above and beyond to help..on the day you contact them in most cases.
Well done Rowhedge Surgery for providing excellent service in these extremely difficult times and all the time!

title: Incredible care
body: After developing emergency spinal symptoms, I called 999 after consulting my neurosurgery dept and GP. The crew arrived quickly, assessed my condition and set about making me comfortable. We have a very limited stairs and landing access and I am a large lady. Despite attempting to sit, it became clear I would need to be extracted flat. The team called additional help and they took time and great care getting me out with as little additional pain to me as possible. Great care was given by extremely caring and dedicated professionals whom I'd like to thank each one personally when this interminable covid allows. In the meantime, thank you all and I'm pleased you enjoyed the view from my bedroom xx

readBy.name: East Of England Ambulance Service NHS Trust

title: Wonderful Service
body:
The organisation of my (first ever) flu jab was exemplary. I was in and out before my appointment time!
Yesterday I emailed the surgery about a medical query and had a phone consultation with MY doctor just after 4pm. Absolutely super service. Thank you to everyone.

title: Poor outcome with this service
body: Been having phone therapy due to Corona virus, every week for 4 weeks,well ,found it didn't help in anyway,felt more angry and confused after the session, didn't understand my issues and problems,and therpests just seemed to read a script at me.fourth call was therpests just swaying me to call it a day with therepy by say do you think it's working and(you can always come back) not what you need to here,I was just abox she needed to tick off the list.,NHS mental health service is a constant disappointment,letting people down at every turn, shameful.

title: Disappointing
body:
Nurses were rude. Receptionist rude. 
I had the flue jab and the woman was so rude, and didn’t even let me sit down. 
Receptionist suddenly made rules over the phone when ive never had a problem before, speaking over me and not offering me appt with doctor for repeat prescription.

title: Awful appointment service
body: It is EXTREMELY difficult to get an appointment at this doctors, if you don't ring bang on 8 you have no hope of even getting through or getting an appointment at all. This system is difficult when you start work at 8am and don't have time to sit pressing re dial for 30-45 mins to find out theres no appointments left. You can't even ring up and book an appointment for another day either which makes it even more frustrating. When it was Matthew Ryder Surgery it was fantastic, much more personable as you actually rang the doctors itself, not some call centre somewhere else. When I have seen any doctors/nurses here they have been nice and helpful but I wouldn't currently recommend this surgery, they seem to have to many people on their books and the phone system can't handle it.

title: shocking practice
body: nightmare to get anything done with this practice from getting anyone on the phone and absolutely no chance of an appointment

title: Great service
body:
Receptionist I spoke to was very kind and helpful with my inquiry. Made me feel very comfortable.
Thank you and keep up the good work!

title: Understanding
body: I found the GP that deals with me very understanding and extremely helpful..also very knowledgeable and caring

title: ‘Reassuring’.
body:
In these uncertain times I know it’s difficult to book face to face GP appointments unless it’s urgent. I rang this morning to book a telephone consultation with a Doctor but there were no appointments available today.
Thanks to the receptionist I spoke to today who has suggested & organised a telephone consultation, for me, with a practice nurse that can deal with my situation. I would also like to take this opportunity to thank this receptionist, who, in the past I have spoken to, for her professionalism & for her most pleasant & reassuring manner.

title: tried to navigate the web site found it really…
body:
I have tried to make an appointment on line and found it really difficult to navigate the site ? I have registered with NHS on line but cannot see how this links in with the process. 
when trying to make an appointment i was asked for my username, what does this mean, Without it I cannot access my password.
I have been with the practice for 40 years it is impossible to see what to do to get this information.   Am I automatically registered for on line services ?
very frustrating when you are feeling ill.

title: Excellent from start to finish
body:
Attended for day surgery.
Many thanks to everyone for their professional and friendly care.
Best tea and toast in the NHS!

readBy.name: Shrewsbury and Telford Hospital NHS Trust

author: ServiceUser100
title: Child's epilepsy care
body: Following onset of new seizures age 13 we have gone through diagnostic assessments and monitoring/ treatment reviews. Services have included MRI under radiology at Ulster Hospital, EEG evaluation at City Hospital Paediatric outpatients at Ulster and Specialist Epilepsy Nurse Service in SEHSCT. Very impressed with all the staff we have encountered who have been empathetic, knowledgeable and professional and have continued to monitor despite COVID restrictions. Our only frustration resulted from how the different hospitals communicate in that the paper referral from one trust to another went missing in postal systems delaying diagnosis. I can't believe in this day and age that services need to rely on unreliable methods such as putting a piece of paper in the post when so many technology solutions are available which are much more efficient and reliable for transfer of information and making referrals. Knowing the benefits of the epilepsy specialist nurse I feel it would also be a real benefit to see them at the same clinic as the paediatrician at the point of diagnosis- we had many many questions but were very conscious of the numbers in the waiting room waiting to see the paediatrician. Access to the specialist nurse in addition would have given us more time with a professional to seek information and reassurance at a very stressful time. Thanks to all staff we have encountered in all departments mentioned.

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust
South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust
Ulster University, Faculty of Life and Health Sciences

author: K1990
title: Ankle injury
body: I broke my ankle went to chard hospital due to lockdown and the staff member I saw was just rude to me. Didn't even put any support or offer any for my ankle. Terrible.

author: Shawsy
title: Tremendous work
body: My husband was admitted to Wishaw ward 18 in October. As a family we can’t thank Dr Kasmer and staff on all levels for the expert level of care given. Thank you for all you do especially in these difficult times. You do tremendous work. We would be lost without our NHS, you’re not appreciated enough. Thank you again from the bottom of our hearts.

readBy.name: Office of Colin Smyth, MSP for South Scotland
South Lanarkshire Health and Social Care Forum

author: BigSteve
title: The Rethink helpline
body:
I'm currently a service user in Sheffield, under the south Sheffield recovery team.  
I first got involved with SHSC when my mental health took a decline and was eventually sectioned. A long story short I ended up living on my own for the first time after discharge from hospital, This was the worst time of my life, so isolated, lonely and generally didn't have a clue what was happening. I ended up with severe depression. If it wasn't for the Crisis House "Rethink" helpline I don't think I would be here today. I've called them most days since leaving hospital and they are friendly, knowledgeable, empathetic and caring. I could list a number of staff there what really stood out for me but haven't got a bad thing to say about any of the staff. I do not know what this will achieve but I just wanted to make sure this little story gets told and I'm ever so thankful of their service.

readBy.name: Sheffield Health and Social Care NHS Foundation Trust

title: No time for patients
body: Doctor didnt even give me a chance  to speak ,she was so fast like she wanted me out of her office as soon as possible after waiting for months to be seen. It hurt so much.

title: Fantastic service - use their online service
body:
On Friday 6th November I used the AccuRX service on the practice website. I submitted my problem and was presented with a number of options around how I wanted contacting i.e. via email/text/telephone/face to face and when I wanted contacting. Because my issue isn't urgent, I opted for telephone and within 3 days. I received a response within 10minutes and had a telephone appointment booked within 3 working days. This suited me.
I had my telephone appointment this morning with an Advanced Nurse Practitioner. She contacted me at the exact time of my appointment and was polite, friendly and listened to everything I had to say. She didn't rush me and talked me through all of my treatment options. She already knew what my issue was as she had read my notes beforehand but still gave me the opportunity to discuss it. She informed me that I needed some blood tests and advised that I would be contacted to book an appointment to have these done. Sure enough, within 10 minutes of putting the phone down, the receptionist contacted me to have a face to face appointment for blood tests. 
I would just like to say a big thank you to EHFP for their excellent service during such a difficult time. 
I would recommend using the AccuRx service to others. Its easy to use, convenient and the practice respond in a timely manner. It definitely beats hanging around on the telephone.
Well done EHFP for a great service.

author: Mummy1234
title: My labour
body: I had a prolonged first stage (3 days) with failure to progress beyond 4cm which eventually resulted in an emergency C section. Myself and my baby then both contracted serious infections and were admitted to hospital for 6 days. I would like to thank the staff at the midwife unit for the unbelievable kindness and care they gave me during my time with them. With my baby in neonatal I had to be wheeled back and forth and needed a lot of help expressing milk to feed him. I could never have done this without them in particular Sarah, a student midwife who was there during labour and supported me the following day. And also Rachel, a support worker in the midwife unit who gave me a level of support I could never have coped without.

author: J-20
title: The midwife went above and beyond
body: I would just like to thank the midwife that sat with myself and my partner while she was in getting started off to bring our twin girls into the world. I have forgot her name but I am sure she will know who she is. This woman couldn't of been anymore helpful to myself and my partner nothing was to much hassle for her. She was there from the start right till the end 2 minutes before her shift ended where she helped deliver my second daughter and even came the next day to see how they were. All the staff were brilliant, this midwife definitely went above and beyond.

title: Amazing welcome and service
body:
I want to say a huge thank you to the staff. As a trans person, who started transition 20 years ago, I’ve had some awful experiences registering with a new GP and it’s never been an easy process. Often with staff wanting to change my details, a lack of knowledge, instructive questions and blocking of healthcare. 

So when I registered at Maple Access, I was nervous. When I rang up, staff were exceptionally helpful and friendly. There were no obstacles put in my way, no intrusive questions, no need for me to educate or justify. I received excellent service and am really thankful and grateful.

title: Incredibly hard working staff
body:
It's a hard and scary time during the pandemic but this practice is always open for people's needs. Sometimes it is hard to get an appointment but there are so many people living in a pretty small town so it's to be expected. I have never been let down by any of the staff here, there all take matters seriously and professionally. 
Very clean and sterile too which is what we want this year aswell. I'm also veey pleased to see temperatures being taken on arrival aswell as hand sanitizer.

title: Communication with patients excellent
body: During these troubled times I must say how well you have communicated with your patients has been excellent. Always receive a text to say that you are open bank holidays during this crisis, something that most patients would not realise. Well done. Communication is key. Thankfully I have not needed to use these additional hours but happy to know that the service is there. Thank you and hope you all keep safe.

title: Fantastic service, thank you
body: My Mum has been shielding since the start of the virus this is the only time she has been out, all precautions were taken to protect both us and the staff and we felt safe at all times and are very grateful.  Mum had to have an xray and have her arm in pot I cannot fault the service/treatment that she received.  Especially thank you to the Nurse who dealt with us and was fantastic.

author: Rossy440
title: Admitted to hospital
body: I took a tablet for itchyness and took an allergic reaction.

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust
Ulster University, Faculty of Life and Health Sciences

author: Tye
title: A visit to A&E
body: A very busy day when I attend the hospital, all the staff from the moment I arrived are very good, my nurses Shannon and Sashi were extremely professional and the care from them was faultless

title: Receptionist have no customer service
body: The receptionist that I have spoken to on a number of occasions is very rude and uncaring. Furthermore the receptionist seems like she has an attitude and can’t wait to get you off the phone. Train your staff in customer care. I would like to point out that I always say thank you at the end but get cut off very quickly before I can even finish what I am saying. The surgery has gone downhill even more and I am already researching a different   GP surgery so I can finally get the correct care that is required. The surgery has never acknowledged any complaint that I have put in to them.

title: Ward 21 Great Staff
body:
The staff that looked after my mum were so good. They were kind, caring and responsive. When any issues arose, my mum was put at ease, listened to and we could not have asked for more. The Team are a Team, and I felt mum was in safe hands. You should be very proud of yourselves, we appreciate all your excellent care. The medical staff, physio, pharmacy, nurses, HCA’s, Ward Clerk, Domestics, Porters. 
Thank you xxx

readBy.name: Wirral University Teaching Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Helpful
body: Could not fault the service I received before and during my surgery.I was very nervous so they allowed my wife to accompany me, I had to travel to Manchester as my surgery was more complex and a taxi was arranged and paid for by the hospital.All staff were wonderful and the surgeon very reassuring.so a huge thank you to you all.

title: Wonderful nurse
body: I went in for a routine check that I'd only had in other practices. The nurse was very friendly, quick, effective and made me feel very comfortable. This is so impressive given the current circumstances everyone is working under and all that PPE she had to wear. I'll never delay a routine check again. Thank you

title: What amazing people
body: I received my letter from Salisbury's Urology department explaining my when my appointment was and directions. Including asking me not to attend more than five minutes before my appointment time, which made perfect sense for safety reasons. On arrival I was greeted with a smile and a warm welcome. Short wait and then greeted by the Urology team, asked to change and present myself when ready. Well we all know what its like the trepidation of having a procedure, starting with the gown of course, luckily they said wear two one for the front and one for the back, Phew what a relief :-) Once gowned, into Urology. Met by the whole team, couldn't have been made to feel more welcome or comfortable, lots of smiles and reassurance from the team. Explanation given of my procedure and what it would entail. Considering I'm a man, they did a wonderful job of easing my nerves and silly thoughts of embarrassment. (its a man thing) My procedure took a while, but the whole time the team were great explaining what was happening and what I needed to do, all delivered with highest levels of courtesy and professionalism, again a smile and a very caring attitude. Procedure completed, explanation on what would happen next, offered a shower, then off to get changed. Back to normality, I cannot thank the Urology team enough for their treatment of me, from the moment I walked in, to the moment I left, wonderful people doing a wonder job, credit to them and the hospital.

author: Scared Mum
title: Lack of provision of mental health service
body:
My 17 year old son developed symptoms of severe depression 10 weeks before his 18th birthday. His GP prescribed an antidepressant and told us that they would like to refer him to CAMHS but couldn’t because he was too close to being 18 when the adult service would take over. Suggested some NHS counselling services but when contacted they replied that they were unable to offer him anything until he was 18. He deteriorated further and 2 weeks later had a serious suicide attempt, ending up in hospital. He was told he would see a DPN from CAMHS prior to Discharge. He waited 6 hours for someone to come who told us that they were actually not a proper member of the crisis team. We asked about his ongoing antidepressant medication and were told that it would be discussed at the crisis team MDT the following day and his GP would be contacted. He was made a follow up appointment with the crisis team 10 days later.  
The outcome of the MDT was not communicated promptly to his GP who had to chase it up and in fact was advised not to give any further medication - however, fortunately our GP started another drug anyway. The follow up appointment was with a ‘practioner’ and health care assistant who offered no suggestions for treatment and was a total waste of time. They again told us to contact the counselling services who had already turned him down. Our GP received no communication from them and tried to speak to a consultant, but this was unhelpful.  
He has remained very ill and has had absolutely no treatment offered by CAMHS for 8 weeks. My husband and I both work within the NHS and in both of our services there is proper provision for 17 year olds to transition across to adult services. The CAMHS service needs to improve this quickly before more young people in their moment of need are failed. We have the resources to take matters into our own hands and have arranged a private psychiatric review and private counselling for our son - many others would not have the resources to do this.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)

title: Appalling
body: I had a telephone appointment with them.  It had been cancelled a few months beforehand then changed then rescheduled.  WHen it finally came I did not get my appointment . I got a rude registrar who hung up on me even though I explained I have autism and other severe problems on top of my chronic physical pain.  The person also refused to give a name and refused to explain what a registar is.  THe person then also claimed to be a consultant neurosurgeon.  I am not sure that you can be a registrar and a consultant but I could be wrong. I have since had to go through  a complaints process which is causing me more stress, especially since I had to go through a complaints process to get any treatment at all from NHS.  The modern system of telephone appointments means they can just now hang up on you when they feel like it. I was not rude, did not swear, there was no reason for me to be treated like that.  It has left me in a terrible state since I had been waiting a long time for that appointment and have to deal with severe pain.  When you try to call back you cannot get through so you are left with an online complaints process which they are allowed to leave for forty days before dealing with. I did write a letter to my actual consultant several months ago, put in the post, got no reply, so wanted to ask for some replies to my questions.  I have been under this hospital now for two and a half years and have only since my consultant once for ten minutes.    It is worrying that the service is so bad because London hospitals tend to be better than elsewhere so.  The area I live in we have even worse hospital services than that.

author: Someone NOT happy
title: Experience with Crisis Team
body:
I suffer with multiple different mental health problems on a daily basis. I have had multiple chats with Carseview’s crisis team due to suicidal ideation and attempts and a lot of self-harm. I was detained by police after being stopped during a suicide attempt, I had also self harmed badly resulting in treatment at Ninewells Hospital. The doctors referred me down to Carseview to talk to the team about how I’m feeling.  
I was left in tears and zero help at all!  
I was spoken to by two different crisis team nurses. From the moment I walked in that room to the moment I left felt like the worst thing that has ever happened to me. I was made to feel at fault for my mental health, I was told that I’m attention-seeking and that the crisis team don't feel able to help me! Is this even allowed?  
I went home with the police after which I then self-harmed more as I was feeling like I had to punish myself, because it felt drilled into my head that I was at fault and they claimed I was now just attention-seeking!  
It made me feel so little, trying to send me home without actually being given a chance to talk. Honestly I know I can complain all I want but nothing will be done, it’s always the same.  
Why be there if you are just going to make things 10x worse.

readBy.name: Yorkshire & Humber Patient Safety Research Collaboration
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)

title: Professional, quick and friendly
body:
I was so impressed with the Old Dairy Health Centre’s extremely professional and prompt way in which they dealt with two health problems with my family, in the last 2 weeks.
I needed urgent antibiotics last week when on holiday in Sussex. After speaking with the helpful receptionist in the morning, my request was dealt with immediately and by lunchtime the GP had called me and organised my medication for me to collect from the local Sussex pharmacy.
My daughter this week needed medication for an eye problem and again the request was dealt with incredibly fast. The GP called us and within an hour we were able to collect the medication from the Dulwich pharmacy.
I felt it was important to let express how much we appreciate the practice’s hard work during these difficult times and the fact that my family has had access to professional advice so quickly, is reassuring.

author: Niceynursey
title: Nightingale Ward
body:
I was admitted to the ward for orthopaedic surgery. This new area is lovely and spacious and calm, just what you need for recovery.  
The staff were all very helpful getting me through, what was for me, a very anxious time, from a kind word and chat before theatre to supporting me through it afterwards.  
Theatre staff on Romola were also very kind  
Allaying my fears and supporting me through the procedure.  
I would to give a special mention to Thembi for her care, as a preceptor staff nurse she was exemplary, thoughtful, knowledgeable and has a lovely manner.  
Also to the surgeon Mr Quorcopome who provided me with the understanding and care to get the knee replacement completed  
I am now at home after being given the best care and attention Along with discharge advice  
Well done to you all xx

title: Great practice
body: I have a great experience with this surgery. I always get appointment whenever I require and easy to get it. The GP are very professional and very supportive. I am very happy with their support and servic.

author: Eddyblue
title: Waiting for follow up
body: Promised CT scan but never got it, been waiting two years for follow up with consultant.

title: Excellent Treatment
body: Once again I have pleasure in writing to say a massive thank you to the brilliant consultant who carried out my reverse full shoulder joint replacement operation on 12 October 2020.  I am also extremely grateful to the nursing and support staff, who looked after me so very well, both before and after my successful operation.  Nothing was too much trouble, and they were kind and reassuring, making me feel relaxed and confident throughout.  So again, a very special thank you to all in ward D5 - you are all very much appreciated.

author: power
title: Outpatient care with no delays
body: My adult disabled son, attended CT Scan department at Musgrove Park Hospital last Wednesday evening. A huge thank you to the radiographer and assistant who welcomed my son, and recognised that he needed initial support from me. They were just so lovely. The cherry on the cake was there were no delays.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)

title: Cold and insensitive
body:
Very bad experience with rheumatology department. I had to wait over 4 months to see someone and a week before the appointment was told it would be by telephone. Despite this causing me great distrss they wouldn't allow me to see someone in person despite me not being in an at risk group. The person who spoke to me over the phone in regards to my collapsed vertebrae was incredibly cold and insensitive despite the clear distress I was in. They bluntly informed me I had osteoporosis and arthritis in the spine without any compassion. This life shattering news was told in passing as if it was nothing despite several times earlier on in the conversation having told of my suicidal feelings as a result of the pain ive suffered constantly the past 8 months. You'd think this news would have been handled delicately considering the state of mind I was in yet it wasn't and left me sobbing uncontrollably. The person clearly knew what they was talking about in regards to rheumatology though their interpersonal skills were atrocious. They came across uncaring and uninterested in my suffering the past 8 months as despite several times bringing up the distress being in pain has caused they never attempted to console me. While I know these are experts in rheumatology, not mental health, I'd still expect them to be able to show care and understanding though they just appeared heartless. Admitedly, I was hostile during the conversation because of being made to wait 4 months for a 20 minute phone call though this was exacerbated as a result of the person's attitude. After being bluntly informed of my disgnosis and left blubbering uncontrollably on the phone, I just hung up as I was getting no compassion from the person and couldn't talk anymore because of the emotional state I was in due to the way I'd been dealt with. The referral I received to see a spinal surgeon afterwards also made little reference to the mental distress my injury put me in. It also referred to me hanging up the phone but gave no context that I hung up while I was in emotional distress crying my eyes out in no small part because of the callus way I'd been dealt with.
All I request from the rheumatology department is first that you realise the importance of face to face appoinments with patients, eapecially those who are not in an at risk group. A face to face appointment means seeing in person the suffering a patient is in, not something that can happen over the phone. It also means being unable to see any deterioration that has happened between any scan and appointment. I also plead with you that when dealing with a patient with mental health issues that you make sure that you assign someone who has good personal skills to break any bad news as this can be the difference between them persevering or being pushed over the edge. Showing care and consideration is vital and so please could you assess which staff deal with patients as having a great knowledge of a subject just isn't enough.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)

author: IPickle
title: My relationship with alcohol
body: My relationship with alcohol began 30 years ago, I eventually reached a point where I realised the relationship is killing me and my family. I called Inclusions and was greeted by Kerry who helped me straight away and sent me the link to a Cuppa with Kerry. My sobriety began then and I’m so pleased, the group chats are not what you would expect and bring some sanity to an otherwise maddening addiction! Thank you Kerry and Lee for all your support. I look forward to more chats and maybe we will all meet one day in person

author: claz
title: Great care
body:
I had a cardio endoscopy procedure to look at my heart. The care I received was outstanding, I was terrified of this procedure having had an awful experience of it when I was a teenager. The team I had which consisted of Dr Ingram, Dr Wells, Maxine, Jane and Natasha was fantastic. Every step of the way the procedure and what was going to happen to me was explained. I had such brilliant care it was probably the best I have ever encountered.  
Dr Ingram was fantastic and explained everything so so well, Please can you ensure that this feedback is given to the hospital.

author: Lottie lou
title: Elderly mum refused at A&E
body:
Took my elderly mum to A&E as she suffers from sciatic. The pain became unbearable and she couldn’t carry out basic tasks like putting on shoes and socks. Her balance was also affected. On arrival she was seen by a nurse who did a set of observations. A few minutes later came back to say a doctor would not be seeing her, and sent her away. I went in and spoke to the doctor to explain how bad the pain was and they still refused to see my mum. On speaking to the doctor, I felt they were quite arrogant and said there was nothing that they were going to do and stated that my mum would not be seen in A&E that day.  
I just think it is unacceptable to refuse care to an elderly person who is in extreme pain.

readBy.name: South Lanarkshire Health and Social Care Forum

title: Very professional
body: From start to finish service was great and in view of the current situation could not have been better

title: Awful service
body: I had an appointment for my dad arranged for audiology and made it through Worcester hospital for today at 10 this morning only to arrive for them to tell us that there was no appointment for him despite me ringing yesterday to double confirm that the appointment was still taking place to get his hearing aids sorted which he’s desperate to get them sorted and it took so much persuading for me to be able to leave them there for them to look at what’s the point in making appointments when you show up to be told that you don’t have an appointment when clearly you do why would someone be there if they didn’t have an appointment

author: Adele849
title: Induction in ARI
body:
This was my third and last pregnancy as unfortunately we lost our baby last year, and then this year we found out I was expecting again 6 months later. Ward 3 were a huge support during what has been both a very anxious time for both me and my husband.  
It was agreed that as my pregnancy this time had been fairly straight forward I could Give birth in Elgin. I was overjoyed at this as my first daughter was born here also and I didn’t want to be too far away from her either when the time came.  
I was due 3rd October but I was late and after many sweeps it was decided an induction would be the way. I couldn’t get an induction until the 12th! This was met with anxiety and huge worry as I felt this was far too long to leave me considering I’d had a still born 6 months previous so I was very anxious also I would have to stay in Aberdeen away from my daughter.  
It was agreed that I would get a cooks balloon inserted on the 11th in ward 3 and then the following day go to Aberdeen for induction. My baby’s heart rate before the balloon could even be inserted went up high. The two midwives said it didn’t look good and that my husband would need to take me straight to Aberdeen with no stopping. So I then had to organise last min child care for my daughter and rush through to Aberdeen with my husband. The journey through was awful we were sick with worry after losing our last baby the very thought of something being wrong just killed us. We arrived just after 5pm in ARI, my husband was allowed in! Baby and I were monitored for 2 hours baby’s heart rate normal. Cooks balloon was inserted and we then got told we could go home! After having nothing to eat as no time to get food before heading through we then decided we would just stay in a nearby hotel. We got a phone call the next morning at 8:30 to come in for 9am to be induced. Just aswell we stayed!  
All was well we got sent directly to the labour delivery suite room. Husband was allowed in again! The induction process started. Then I got told my baby’s heart rate was dipping with every contraction. A dr tried to put a clip on my baby’s head but this was accidentally clipped on the side of my cervix inside instead.. fast forward 3 hours later with just gas and air and extreme pain. They stopped the drip. The dr got consultant to try remove clip and suggested epidural. Which by the way was Great pain relief but I think should’ve been put in before they tried to remove clip! I cannot fault the midwives and I felt they were so unfairly rushed off their feet! They managed to get clip off with use of forceps. They then got the clip on my baby’s head and started the process of induction again. The consultant wanted a blood sample off my baby’s head to check oxygen levels. This was not possible. My baby’s heart rate continued to dip and was in distress so it was decided I would need emergency c section. I desperately did not want this as I knew my husband would need to go soon to offshore leaving me to recover alone with my 5 year old daughter. In the current state of things we could not afford for him to take more time off adding more anxiety. The staff in the theatre were fantastic and my son was born at 19:39.  
My husband had to leave soon after but was very much appreciative of the fact he got to cut the cord and see his son being born.  
In recovery I had a temperature and it was decided I and my son would need antibiotics IV. My son was wheeled away to have cannula put in. About midnight we got put on the ward and was told we wouldn’t be allowed home for a few days till I was well and my son was well too. I couldn’t fault the staff on the maternity ward. It gets so busy and you are left to it picking baby up and showering etc. I managed fine though. I did feel disappointed that I didn’t get told anything about what caused the infection that caused the temperature or any results of the bloods and swabs they took. Hardest part was my husband couldn’t visit unless he booked a time slot which was hard to get. He could only get a late in afternoon appointment and by then our daughter who was with grandparents would’ve been away for two nights so we both felt it would be better for him to head home to take care of her. I found this very difficult I often got upset during my stay missing my husband and daughter. Especially the fact they couldn’t get to see our son and brother. After everything we have gone through this was heart breaking. I understand it is about safety but very hard mentally to cope with.  
Day 4- all was well and then at night time I asked for pain relief which I had been getting every night before bed to settle pain. The staff member I asked was very rude and said that the pain relief I wanted was too strong and shouldn’t be needed at this stage and couldn’t be given with paracetamol which I had already been getting previously. I’m a nurse so I know this to be false. The attitude was disgraceful. They said if I was that bad I would need to wait an hour and buzz for it. I was in pain and tears missing my family etc. Came back after an hour and gave me my the pain relief and to tell me I would be going home the next day anyways and wouldn’t be getting that sort of pain relief!  
The next day I asked the midwife as I hadn’t been told anything about my results or my sons recent blood results. Or anything really about treatment or what I should or shouldn’t do ie after having a section. The breast feeding nurse spent 10 mins with me then spent 2 hours with another patient, seemingly not bothered how I felt about my sons feeding as he has a tongue tie I’ve just discovered. The midwife who discharged me never came back to tell me results but came to tell me I was being discharged home in an hour. I told my husband and he left to come for us. I was told he wouldn’t be allowed onto ward to help me out to car either. I was discharged with paracetamol and told I wouldn’t be allowed any stronger pain relief for the journey home to Elgin.  
  
My community midwife arrived the next day and told me I was allowed stronger pain relief and was entitled to diclofenac as well. Which I didn’t get from Aberdeen.  
My son is home healthy and well, I’m recovering well. I’m really grateful but I can’t help but feel let down and disappointed at how bad things have gotten. My 4 weeks post surgery and my husbands went offshore I feel very supported by the midwives, health visitor and ward 3. I wouldn’t wish this on any new mum and hope they get the services back to normal. This just isn’t safe and with the ever increasing population in Elgin they can’t keep sending people to Aberdeen and not use dr grays.

author: Lills
title: Helping to cope with my depression and anxiety
body:
I participated in the living skillfilly course over video group meetings.  
This helped me to realise and come to terms with my situation and knowing that I was not alone in feeling depressed and suffering from. anxiety.  
The mindfulness, Tip, body scans skills helped me to control my emotions and distract myself from feeling low and anxious.  
I used the skills to help with meditation, breathing exercises and to  
Concentrate on what my body was telling me. It helped calm me and I begun to slowly distract myself from worrying so much much, blaming myself in situations which were out of my control.  
I know feel that I am in more control on my emotion, although some days are better than others.  
Very thankful to all the team.

title: Fabulous Surgery
body:
I have been a patient at this surgery for 25 plus years and would like to say how wonderful the staff and doctors are. They are always so kind and caring and go out of their way to help. The doctors are very helpful and I have also had very efficient assistance from the Private Medical Report Administrator over the years. 
A professional and caring surgery.

title: Read google reviews
body: The surgery is very poorly managed,  it is difficult to get an appointment and when you complain about trying to get through, they act like is very strange, they try and direct you to out of hours or A&E when it is totally unnecessary.  If you read the reviews on Google the common issue is not getting through or phone being picked up. I’ve tried to get a prescription to be sent to the pharmacist for one week now when the turn around should be 48 hours.

author: Lesley S
title: My dad in Ward 11
body: My dad was admitted to Ward 11, the Stroke Ward over 2 weeks ago. It has been horrendous not being able to see him. I believe it's affecting him and all of us on the outside. The staff are amazing and I dont know what I would do without their calls and video calls. It's a lifeline to us and I am so grateful they take the time to do this. I heard my dad speak today for the 1st time in a while and it meant everything. I still think one of us should be allowed to visit if we wear the same as the nurses. It would help him and take the load off a very busy ward staff. Thank you so much. ❤

title: Incredible Care
body: Everyone involved with the treatment I received after my heart attack were perfect in the execution of their duties, and it was all done with great compassion and care. From the operator on the 111 phone line, the amazing paramedics, the surgeon and his brilliant team, the consultants, and most of all the incredibly hard working and thoughtful nurses and staff within the cardiac care unit, each and every one of these amazing human beings helped me through the scariest and toughest few days of my life. I will forever be grateful to them for what they did for me and continue to do for others.

author: Curlingcows
title: Phone calls not returned
body: My son, now aged 15, has been vomiting sporadically after meals for the past 18 months and has eventually been referred for an endoscopy to try and find out what's wrong. He is otherwise fit and well and a keen footballer but is now increasingly becoming reluctant to take part in activities as that usually makes him feel unwell. He was referred for an endoscopy on 3 months ago and despite 3 calls to QE hospital, am unable to find out when potentially this may take place or indeed if he is going to be given one as calls either aren't returned after messages or a promised return phone call doesn't happen. I appreciate clinics and consultations are running behind and there is a lot of uncertainty because of Covid19 but a return phone call to advise what was happening would show respect and give me some confidence that my son has not been 'lost' in the system.

readBy.name: Office of Colin Smyth, MSP for South Scotland
South Lanarkshire Health and Social Care Forum

author: Nonnasandra
title: Wonderful sense of humour
body: Chloe and David took exceptionally good care of me when David decided he could do the BCC removal there and then. With a wonderful sense of humour and very skilled at putting me at my ease, he did the minor operation just under my left eye. Everything went really well, 2 stitches and no black eye. Just first class health care from two consummate professionals, thank you.

title: A good visit
body: I attended on 3rd November for a minor operation.  I had to travel some distance and arrived early.  Having checked out the parking arrangements I went to Reception who directed me to the Dermatology Dept.  I was early so did not expect to see anyone but being first I was invited in by the consultant.  Since everyone required was there he asked if I would like to start early to which I agreed.  The operation took longer than expected.  I have nothing but praise for the consultant and the two nurses who assisted him.  I was made to feel as comfortable as possible and they kept me informed as to what was happening.  At the end the consultant spoke with me and answered all my questions.  I was given my prescription which I took to the pharmacy.  I had a 30 minute wait for my prescription but since I needed a little break before driving home this was not a problem.

readBy.name: University Hospitals Coventry and Warwickshire NHS Trust

author: Ellaju
title: Consultant led care during pregnancy
body:
I had been planning on having a home birth since the beginning of my pregnancy, but was considered high risk and knew it would be against guidelines. I first saw Dr Raheja in my third trimester and fully expected her to try to put me off having a home birth. I had been feeling very anxious about going to the appointment for this reason.  
While she did go through the risks with me, it was done in a way that still made me feel in control and not pressured to decide a certain way. She also explained how the chance of those things happening were low. When I said that I would still want a home birth, she was very supportive and left it at that.  
I came away from the appointment feeling able to fully relax knowing that my consultant was on board with my plans. It made a huge difference to the remainder of my pregnancy, she was brilliant.

title: Great practice
body: Have only been with the practice for a year have no complaints. Can always speak to a Dr if need be through their e-consult triage. Blood tests quick and efficient including flu jab, all this while working with Covid. Found e-consult triage a little irritating at first and I’m computer literate but always a friendly voice at The the end of the phone if need be.

title: Great care
body:
Although transferred to a major trauma centre on 4/11, the support and care I received from the ambulance crew, the ED team at Torbay and, finally, those on Ainslie ward was top class - professional, but also very caring.

My surgery has now happened and my recovery is underway. It will take time, probably a lot of time - but the Torbay team laid good foundations.

readBy.name: Torbay and South Devon NHS Foundation Trust

title: Excellent
body: My wife and attended for the 'flu injection which was handled efficiently by pleasant staff. No waiting and no problems.

author: Happy mum 2020
title: My daughters day surgery
body:
My daughter Lucy came to the Royal Hospital for Children for dental surgery. We were looked after at every stage and lather had a long wait, Lucy was given crafts to keep her busy and there were films to watch so we didn’t actually need most of the activities that we brought with us.  
The anaesthetist, dentist and nurses were all so kind and made me feel confident leaving Lucy when it was time for her to have her procedure.  
I couldn’t recommend the staff and service highly enough, thank you to everyone involved!

author: Sudeki
title: Nerve scan
body: When I arrived at the hospital, I was dealt with promptly, straight in for the test I had gone for. The team on duty that day was absolutely brilliant, made me feel very calm and relaxed under these covid times. Couldn't ask for more.

title: Professional and Considerate.
body:
The beginning of last year I had both eyes treated for cataracts by Spa Medica Wirral. The whole team where considerate, skilful and professional. 
This month I needed a correction in my right eye.  Considering, the climate we are all living in at this time with Covid, Spa Medica where superb. 
My sight in that eye, after a day or so is back to HD.
Thanks again Spa Medica.

title: Excellent COVID test experience
body: I brought my 7 year old daughter to Crosshouse for COVID 19 test, she was nervous but the lady who completed her test (I think her name was Theresa) was absolutely fantastic and made something which could have been a daunting experience, smooth and fun. Just wanted to thank her so much since I wasn't able to in these current circumstances. You were fantastic :)

readBy.name: Office of Colin Smyth, MSP for South Scotland

author: KC-20
title: COPD help
body:
I have COPD. I am also not an individual who attends the GP for what I would term minor illnesses. However, prior to being diagnosed I had attended my GP complaining of chest pains on several occassions.. My diagnosis did not come to light until after I had collapsed at home then rushed into hospital.  
Since the pandemic, I feel my health is deteriorating and have a great fear of both contracting and passing the disease onto my immediate family.  
I feel since being diagnosed the only support that has been provided to me so far has been an appointment with the nurse and was curious if there are any treatments for COPD that could help me live as normal a life as is possible ??  
Please advise ... Many thanks in advance :-)

title: Amazing practice!
body: This practice is so efficient and professional. All staff are very polite and helpful. The doctors are amazing in what they do!

author: Fantail
title: Video consultation with haematologist
body:
The appointment was booked 3 months before and easy to access the site. I logged on 5 minutes before appointment as requested. A recorded message said that the team knew I was there and would be with me shortly. After 30 minutes I phoned the department who told me that the doctor would contact me. A message came through after a few minutes to say that the doctor would be with me soon. After about 5 minutes he was. The consultation lasted less than 5 minutes.  
I was not happy that I was kept waiting, logged on to site, for so long. Video consultations should show who is waiting and if a delay is unavoidable a message should be sent.

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

author: Sami crew
title: Professional staff in the A&E
body:
My son had an accident on Saturday evening. He had to be brought in to observe the bump to his head. He is 4 years old, so not the most articulate or happy patient.  
The staff and Northwick Park A&E were all so amazing. From the Security Guard, the receptionist, nurses and doctors.  
Everyone was super busy but they took their time to help and explain things. It must be so difficult working during these times but they had a smile on their face which really put my son at ease.  
I cannot thank or rate them highly enough.

readBy.name: London North West University Healthcare NHS Trust

title: Good, Reliable practice
body:
Recently moved into the area and registered with Homewell Practice.

Found their online booking system extremely useful especially for busy people who can just go online and have a consultation instead of be on hold on the phone for a long time to be connected to the reception. The online booking system is flexible and easy to use.

From experience, they have responded to my requests very quickly. Very little waiting time to be seen as well. Receptionist are not particularly friendly however the nurses do a fantastic job.

title: Excellent service...so far
body: I have had one eye 'done'. I was in and out in 90 minutes, and received excellent care. Well done everyone!

title: New to this practice
body:
As an older person it’s very easy to be ignored
In the short time l have been at this practice l have found patience and understanding , given the amount of work involved in their recent move 
and the Pandemic l find this deserves recognition
Long may it continue

title: Econsult
body: I tried to leave an econsult on the website I gave all the information asked for. I was told to get medical help from 111 . I was trying to tell my doctor I'd had to stop using a prescribed medication

title: Telephone consultation poor service
body: Called for an urgen appt regarding a cancer surgical procedure request form . Was given a phone consultation for 12 pm for the following day, which is fine, considering the surgery was in two days. And told that they could call me anytime between 12.00 and 13.00, which is quite a big slot, but being NHS still fine. On the day of consultation was well past 13.00 and no Drs call to be seen. Called the GP to check on this (which is really really hard to get through every time), to be told that yes I am booked but the Dr can call me at any time in a 3 to 4 hour window as hundreds of appointments are made for that time slot. This is absolutely ridiculous. Depending of the work you do, you might need to take the whole afternoon off to be able to pick up your GPs phone call, and you need to make sure you have you phone next to you during 4 hours to make sure you don't loose that call? This is really poor service from the GP practice, please treat and care for your patients as a whole not just at your convenience. Would you think it would be acceptable to make me wait 4 hours in the GP practice for a face to face consultation? Off course not. Guess what?! it also isn't acceptable doing so on a phone consultation.

author: dgb
title: Visit to outpatient clinic
body:
I was referred to the skin clinic for sn outpatient procedure during high covid levels.  
The outpatient service was really good. There was no waiting around and no other patients in close proximity. The staff wore protective equipment and were very reassuring. The procedure was a success.  
The clinic provided an excellent service.

readBy.name: Sheffield Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Repeat prescription
body:
Asthma review required to order a new inhaler which I can understand.
I was told there would be no face to face appointments so would be done over the phone. I was given a date and time for the call but no one called. 
I put a request again for my prescription but again said I needed a asthma review. 
I rang them and they told me I missed the appointment at the surgery, I told them it was a phone call appointment as they were not seeing face to face to which she had no answer.
I have rang again today and they have told me they have no appointments for the next couple of weeks with the nurse. They said they would call me back. I’m really not holding my breath on this to be honest.
I really do need this inhaler ASAP but help is absolutely terrible.

title: Rude and not professional
body:
Been there for my son’s vaccination, the nurse is rude and in rush. She hesitated to touch my baby and didn’t describe anything about immediate effect of vaccination 💉. I understand the COVID-19 thing but this is not the professional procedure to check someone especially kids.  
Regards

title: Inconvenient parking
body: Very difficult .no extremly difficult to park or even drop off someone ...let alone.elderly person who is already anxious/ stressed about forth coming appt. Suggest volounteers with welcoming badges to alleviate this and car park marshalls.....

title: Worrying service
body: I am a regular patient at the surgery and have noticed in recent months that it is deteriorating and becoming dangerous. Phone calls for blood results etc are taking up to 3 weeks to book. This concerns me as face to face appointments should be limited whilst we are in a pandemic allowing more time and space for telephone appointments. After a number of attempts to contact the surgery during open hours I have been directed to the emergency line after being told the surgery is shut! This has happened on a number of occasions. Due to this I have submitted an e-consult which is supposed to help free up telephone lines etc. However the response from the e-consult is always ‘please contact the surgery!’ What’s the point in filling out these forms if we have to call in anyway? I know we are in the middle of a pandemic but at what point can we stop using this an excuse?

title: Refusal to provide a 2 year old with the flu jab
body:
The receptionist refused to book an appointment for my 2 year old to have the flu jab stating unless she had underlying health problems she wasn't entitled.
I've since been informed this is/was not the case.
Why did the receptionist refuse to book my daughter's flu jab appointment?

title: Excellent Practice
body: I came into A&E having experienced symptoms of a mini stroke. The care I received was excellent. The problem was diagnosed quickly, I felt that my concerns were listened to, tests were organised on the same day, medication prescribed and I was referred to the Stroke service. Your excellent Stroke nurse was very efficient, I had a range of other tests including scans and came away feeling that I had been treated professionally and knew what I had to do what the next steps were. I have subsequently spoken to the consultant on a telephone consultation. He was very helpful and explained what they had found on all scans and heart monitoring. I feel confident that if I needed to have further treatment it would be handled with the same care, professionalism  and compassion. I have nothing but praise for the North Mid.

readBy.name: North Middlesex University Hospital NHS Trust

title: Very thorough investigation
body:
The doctors provided very excellent and thorough analysis to diagnose and treat 
 a difficult issue.
I wish to praise also the admin staff who were always helpful and friendly as well as very professional at all times.

title: Wonderful caring practice
body: I had to contact surgery several times during lockdown and visited for a flu jab in October. My queries and requests were received and responded to promptly with kindness, understanding and caring, and appropriate action taken to assist with further investigations. I truly felt so well supported at a time when I am aware that you must be working under enormous pressure. My grateful thanks thanks to all the team, GPs, practice nurse and receptionist.

title: Exceeded my expectations
body:
I called today around noon, concerned about my 81 year old mum.  The receptionist called me back within 15 minutes so say a paramedic would be coming around. He visited approx 2pm, contacted Brookside surgery to report his findings and by 3pm, I had collected medication and the first dose had been administered! 
We are in the middle of a Pandemic and Lockdown and I thought we would just have a telephone conversation but the service we received was far in excess of what I expected, huge thanks to the NHS staff

title: Flu jab
body: Appointment ahead of the booked schedule, and efficient service by the staff to complete this operation without fuss or drama. My compliments and thank you.

title: Friendly staff
body: I visited the fracture clinic - trauma and orthopaedic as an outpatient following my ankle reconstruction operation. The staff were lovely and friendly. They very kindly brought me a cup of tea while I was waiting for the ambulance to take me home which I thought was really nice of them because they were very busy. They also arranged my next appointment and even booked the ambulance. I was quite nervous about this appointment but their friendliness put me at ease. Thank you so much.

title: Excellent
body: My Endoscopy went so well, although very nervous and anxious being 1st time, all doctors, colleagues and staff, made you feel so welcome and re-assured you at all times, brilliant service and even taking time to check on me next day to see if all was well which is was, well done team under these difficult times, you are doing a brilliant job, my experience was much better than i thought, not allowed to mention any names but you were so brilliant, thank you once again for doing a brilliant job, you are a credit to our NHS

title: Immediate action should be taken
body:
After being with this practice for a few years now, I don't have many good experiences. The nail on the head is today after phoning the very cold and rude receptionists who don't let me finish my sentences whilst being out of breathe with asthma and pregnant. I am polite and patient and instead have to ask them to let me finish what I'm saying. I came for a routine vaccine yesterday, sat down to have it done, to then be told I'm not far along enough in my pregnancy to have it. I decided to double check this today and 3 different opinions from my midwife, pharmacy and on the NHS website state its safe from 16 weeks. I'm now 19 and don't want to leave this and waste more time coming into a surgery during corona virus.

Today a receptionist contradicted another receptionist'advice and told me that all reception staff are NOT qualified to give out medical advice. Why is it the last 5 times or so I have called, have I had a receptionist ask me personal questions or told me advice regarding my inhalers, and vaccines? If this is the case someone needs to review the phone line team because its confusing and misleading. Any member of public / patient is going to go with any advice given from a practice because we wouldn't expect to be given false or misleading advice.

Every time I call I'm always forced to practically beg for an appointment or phone appointment, or told to call back at 8.30. Is this really efficient and what about people who are unable to call at that time due to work commitments? It seems to be first come first served and I think that's extremely unfair to older more unhealthy /unable patients who I've personally met. Today I went to collect my repeat prescription; yet again, the pharmacy said I need to contact the GP to release it. I've been using this inhaler for months and months now, I've always done as I've been asked which is to order it online every single month without fail, but today was made to feel on the phone that it was my fault. I don't particularly feel leaving this review will change things, but seeing the rest of the reviews on here and Google, I would be very concerned if no improvements or training was implicated to this surgery, especially before more and more patients will be joining over the upcoming years. 

Please take the time to see why the phone system and reception team are so poor.

title: Excellent practice
body:
I would just like to pass on our thanks to a wonderful team at the River Place group practice. Mum has been a patient at River Place for many years and I can honestly say the support and response to her needs  she has been given over this time has been wonderful.
This has been a great comfort for me with all the health problems mum has faced over the years. Thank you.

title: Great service
body: I would like to congratulate the team at Central on a well run flu clinic. The staff were all wearing masks and aprons and I felt very safe going to the practice. I was not near or in contact with any other patients.  I was not kept hanging around and was in and out in no time at all. Everyone was friendly, polite and helpful in what must be very busy and difficult times for them. Thank you to you all.

author: AlliS
title: nursing and medical care
body:
Following Coronavirus restrictions whereby day surgery lists were postponed I was contacted recently when the lists were reinstated and my care pathway from the very first consultation with Dr Ali has been excellent. If I could I would like to identify every single healthcare worker who was part of the team, as no team can offer specialist care without the various team members regardless of their role. Suffice to say from Margaret, the day surgery scheduler (who worked hard to accommodate my clinic appointments and did so with kindness and efficiency & great patience) to my initial pre-op assessment carried out by truly wonderful nurses at Stobhill Hospital I have been grateful for the truly professional and caring manner shown to me.  
As a nurse myself I experience caring and compassionate staff every day. I just need to let management know that every day they are performing outstanding care under intense pressure. Ashley and Natalie were both nurses who I met initially who explained the procedures to me and walked me through the next stages. These nurses were professional, knowledgeable and just really kind and friendly. The excellent care continued through to day surgery at the New Victoria where the nursing and medical staff were first class. Lynne, Beth, Meg and Shirley provide superb nursing care and made me feel at ease and relaxed. They took great care of me. I had never met the medical team prior to the day of surgery but I was immediately at ease with them. The anaesthetics team were first class and Dr Higgins and her registrar need particular mention for their expert surgical care.  
We are all working hard within the NHS to deliver safe, effective care. I'd like to think I am a small part of the bigger picture delivering that care, but being on the receiving end is always strange. But I needed to mention the care I received and say thank you to everyone who provided that care. All of you deserve more than a few words of praise from me.  
Special mention to my GP (Dr Ali). He is truly an excellent GP!

readBy.name: St. Andrews University ScotGEM Medical Students
East Renfrewshire Health & Social Care Partnership
